info.title: Mock Spotify REST API
info.description: Based on the Spotify Web API, this is a version that takes a small slice of that Web API and returns hard-coded mock data.

get.description: Get a list of Spotify featured playlists (shown, for example, on a Spotify player's 'Browse' tab).
Get a playlist owned by a Spotify user.
Get full details of the items of a playlist owned by a Spotify user.

post.description: Add one or more items to a user's playlist.

schema.title: Position (append by default)
schema.description: The position to insert the items, a zero-based index. For example, to insert the items in the first position: `position=0`; to insert the items in the third position: `position=2`. If omitted, the items will be appended to the playlist. Items are added in the order they are listed in the query string or request body.

schema.title: Spotify Track URIs
schema.description:
A comma-separated list of [Spotify URIs](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids) to add, can be track or episode URIs. For example:
`uris=spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh, spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M, spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ`
A maximum of 100 items can be added in one request.
_**Note**: it is likely that passing a large number of item URIs as a query parameter will exceed the maximum length of the request URI. When adding a large number of items, it is recommended to pass them in the request body, see below._

get.description:
Get Spotify catalog information about albums, artists, playlists, tracks, shows, episodes or audiobooks that match a keyword string.
**Note: Audiobooks are only available for the US, UK, Ireland, New Zealand and Australia markets.**

schema.title: Query
schema.description:
Your search query. You can narrow down your search using field filters. The available filters are `album`, `artist`, `track`, `year`, `upc`, `tag:hipster`, `tag:new`, `isrc`, and `genre`. Each field filter only applies to certain result types. The `artist` and `year` filters can be used while searching albums, artists and tracks. You can filter on a single `year` or a range (e.g. 1955-1960).
The `album` filter can be used while searching albums and tracks.
The `genre` filter can be used while searching artists and tracks.
The `isrc` and `track` filters can be used while searching tracks.
The `upc`, `tag:new` and `tag:hipster` filters can only be used while searching albums. The `tag:new` filter will return albums released in the past two weeks and `tag:hipster` can be used to return only albums with the lowest 10% popularity.

schema.title: Item type
schema.description:
A comma-separated list of item types to search across. Search results include hits
from all the specified item types. For example: `q=abacab&type=album,track` returns
both albums and tracks matching "abacab".

schema.title: Limit
schema.description: The maximum number of results to return in each item type.

schema.title: Offset
schema.description:
The index of the first result to return. Use
with limit to get the next page of search results.

schema.title: Include External
schema.description:
If `include_external=audio` is specified it signals that the client can play externally hosted audio content, and marks
the content as playable in the response. By default externally hosted audio content is marked as unplayable in the response.

language.description: The language used in the episode, identified by a  {@link  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639 ISO 639 }  code.
The language used in the episode, identified by a  {@link  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639 ISO 639 }  code.

NotFound.description: The requested resource cannot be found.
